results.title: S.O.S.: save our sons
results.creator_credit: Rebecca McLean, Elisa Argenzio and S O S Pictures Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: The gaoling of the ‘Fairlea Five’ was the first many Australians had heard of the Save our Sons movement; a group of women formed in the sixties to protest against the Vietnam War. S.O.S explores the motivation of this group of women, charting their progress from their unpopular beginnings in 1965, to the moratoriums and re-election of the Labour Party in 1972. The film uses interviews, original footage and news clippings to illustrate their strategies (both conventional and non-conventional), specific areas of protest (including anti-conscription and conscientious objecting), and their achievements over this time.

results.title: S.O.S. iceberg
results.brief_description: The story of Dr Karl Laurence, an explorer who in the interest of Arctic research, set off to carry on the scientific investigation with the North Pole. A short film which has some great special effects with the iceberg.

results.title: Rythmetic
results.creator_credit: Evelyn Lambart, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film by Norman McLaren and Evelyn Lambart which endows arithmetic with lively humour. The screen becomes a numerical free-for-all as digits meet in playful encounter, add and subtract, jostle, attack, elude one another. (Ten awards: including Edinburgh, British Film Academy)

results.title: Ryan's daughter
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Anthony Havelock-Allan and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Robert Mitchum is the rural school master Charles Shaughnessy who, returning home to Ireland in 1916, just after the Easter Rising against the British, falls in love with and marries one of his old pupils, Rosy Ryan. Their happiness is upset by the arrival of a Major who comes to take command of the British Army and is immediately drawn towards Rosy. Political events finally overtake all affairs of the heart, and it is obvious that life in the village of Kirrary will never be the same again. Scripted by Robert Bolt the film also stars Sarah Miles, John Mills, Trevor Howard and Leo McKern.

results.title: Rwanda
results.creator_credit: Joanne Harding, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Joanne Harding was sent to Rwanda as part of the Australian Defence Force medical Support Force. She focuses on the part of her experience that affected her the most, the eyes of the children. She describes their eyes as pools of nothingness as they begin to accept war as part of their everyday life. In turn, Joanne begins to question the effectiveness of her role and that of the United Nations in bringing peace to this wartorn country.

results.title: Ruthless people
results.creator_credit: Jerry Zucker, David Zucker, Jim Abrahams, Michael Peyser, Wagner Productions, Silver Screen Partners II and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A black comedy tale of two kindly kidnappers, Ken and Sandy Kessler, exacting revenge on the rip-off merchant Sam (Danny DeVito) by taking his spoilt rich wife, Barbara (Bette Midler) as hostage. However when the Kesslers try to claim their ransom, the obnoxious and spiteful Sam, who is delighted at the opportunity to be rid of the wife he hates so much, refuses to pay. Barbara joins forces with the Kesslers and together they plan their revenge. Cast includes Judge Reinhold, Helen Slater, Anita Morris and Bill Pullman in his debut performance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Zucker, David Zucker, Jim Abrahams, Michael Peyser, Wagner Productions, Silver Screen Partners II and Touchstone Pictures

results.title: Ruth Stout's garden
results.brief_description: A revealing portrait of a charming individualist illustrating that age need not be a barrier to continued productivity and creativity. Ruth Stout, now in her tenth decade, remains active writing books, contributing regularly to periodicals, lecturing and perfecting her ‘no dig/no work’ method of gardening.

results.title: Rusty: the great rescue
results.creator_credit: Shuki Levy, Craig Golin and Saban Entertainment
results.brief_description: Rusty is a lovable, trusty beagle that lives at an animal shelter full of a great variety of animals. The human couple who run the shelter are grandparents to two recently orphaned kids. All seems fine until two crooks steal some puppies in order to take the trust fund from the kids. Rusty and his animal friends set out on an adventurous rescue to put things straight. Talking animals and colourful country setting make this a film for the family to enjoy. Directed by Shuki Levy. Cast includes Hal Holbrook, Rue McClanahan, Laraine Newman. Voices provided by Suzanne Somers, Rodney Dangerfield and Bobcat Goldthwait.
